channel.title: US Elections 2024 Latest Updates: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: US Elections News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: US Elections 2024 Latest Updates: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Interim govt to stop Awami rally
Awami student wing chief says working to restore democracy
item.description: Forced into hiding after their organization was banned by Bangladesh's interim government, the president of the Chhatra League told TOI that they are using social media to regroup and plan their next moves to restore democracy in the country. He added that over a lakh students are being prevented from continuing their education.
item.dc:creator: Mohua Chatterjee

item.title: North Korean GPS manipulation disrupted dozens of planes and vessels, South Korea says
item.description: North Korea disrupted GPS signals near its western border for a second day, impacting flights and ships. This follows a pattern of escalating tensions, with North Korea engaging in electronic warfare and propaganda campaigns against South Korea, raising concerns about aviation safety and regional stability.

item.title: American tourist on vacation found dead in Hungary; suspect arrested
item.description: An American tourist, Mackenzie Michalski, was tragically found dead in Hungary after being reported missing. The suspect, an Irish citizen she met at a nightclub, confessed to killing her during an "intimate encounter" and attempting to conceal the crime.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: China, Indonesia cos set to ink $10bn deals
5 siblings, some deaf, among dead in Israeli hits in Lebanon
Qatar cannot continue Gaza talks, warns Hamas over Doha office: Source
Famine looming in north Gaza: UN-backed report
item.description: Famine is looming in the northern Gaza Strip amid increased hostilities and a near-halt in food aid, a UN-backed assessment said Saturday. The alert from the Famine Review Committee warned of "an imminent and substantial likelihood of famine occurring, due to the rapidly deteriorating situation in the Gaza Strip."

item.title: Maersk ship denied docking at Spanish port over Israel arms
Over 130 homes lost in Calif wildfire; rare brushfire in NY
item.description: Firefighters in California are making progress against a massive wildfire that has destroyed over 100 homes near Los Angeles, as calmer weather conditions provide some relief. Meanwhile, New York City battled a rare brushfire in Brooklyn's Prospect Park, fueled by dry conditions and high temperatures that have sparked numerous blazes across the northeastern United States.

item.title: Iran to Trump: Change policy of 'max pressure'
Trump adviser: Priority in Ukraine is peace, not return of lost territory
item.description: A top aide to President-elect Donald Trump revealed the new administration's focus in Ukraine will be on achieving peace, not reclaiming lost territories like Crimea. Bryan Lanza emphasized the need for Ukraine to present a "realistic vision for peace," suggesting that demanding Crimea's return would be a non-starter. While Ukraine insists on the return of all captured territory, Russia signaled openness to Trump's peace proposals amidst ongoing conflict.

item.title: Afghanistan to attend UN climate summit for first time since Taliban takeover
item.description: For the first time since the Taliban took control, an Afghan delegation will be present at the UN climate summit in Azerbaijan. Despite not being officially recognized by any nation, the Taliban emphasize that their political isolation shouldn't hinder their involvement in crucial climate discussions.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kate Middleton joins royals at Remembrance Day event after cancer recovery
item.description: Princess Kate Middleton, recently having completed chemotherapy for an undisclosed illness, made a poignant appearance at the Festival of Remembrance in London. The event, honoring fallen soldiers, saw the Princess in black attire adorned with a symbolic red poppy.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US couple stab and shoot each other to death while 11-year-old son plays video games
item.description: In a horrifying incident on Halloween, a married couple in Washington State was found dead in their kitchen after a violent altercation. Their 11-year-old son, unaware of the tragedy due to wearing earbuds, discovered their bodies and alerted authorities.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'They didn't like her': Bill Maher on Harris' presidential loss
item.description: On his show "Real Time," Bill Maher challenged journalists' explanations for Kamala Harris's presidential loss to Donald Trump. He dismissed claims that Harris lacked time to connect with voters, arguing that Americans found her unfavorable. Maher criticized attempts to attribute her defeat to sexism or racism, asserting that the public simply wasn't impressed with her campaign.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: UK government scrambles to repair damage to UK-US special relationship caused by Labour supporting Harris and tweets attacking Trump
item.description: The UK government is navigating a diplomatic challenge as past criticisms of US President-elect Donald Trump by Labour Party members resurface. Trump's lawyers have called for an investigation into potential foreign interference related to Labour staff campaigning for Kamala Harris. Despite previous strong criticisms, Labour figures, including Keir Starmer and David Lammy, have reached out to Trump and emphasized the importance of the US-UK relationship.
item.dc:creator: NAOMI CANTON

item.title: No 10 Diwali party serves alcohol and meat, leaves British Indians repulsed
item.description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer's Diwali celebration at No. 10 Downing Street sparked controversy among British Indians. The inclusion of meat and alcohol in the menu drew criticism and was deemed disrespectful to the religious significance of the festival. Hindu groups expressed disappointment and urged for cultural sensitivity in future events.
item.dc:creator: NAOMI CANTON

item.title: Oprah Winfrey reportedly charged $1 million for hosting Harris' interview and campaign event
item.description: Kamala Harris' presidential campaign invested heavily in media appearances, including a $1 million payment to Oprah Winfrey for a rally and interview. Despite significant spending on events and podcasts, some critics argue these efforts failed to resonate with voters or distance Harris from the then-current administration.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: No sex, no marriage: Women protest Trump’s win by boycotting relationships with men
item.description: Inspired by South Korea's "4B" movement, some American women are boycotting relationships with men and abstaining from sex in protest of Donald Trump's presidential victory. They cite concerns about reproductive rights and the rise in young male Republican voters as their reasons for participating in the movement.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
